title: Savory French Onion Meatloaf with Tangy Glaze for Cozy Dinners
promptIMG: Food photography: French onion meatloaf, appetizing presentation, natural lighting, kitchen setting, documentary style, realistic colors --ar 4:3 --quality 2
description: This French onion meatloaf is a comforting dish that brings warmth to any table. With sweet caramelized onions and a tangy glaze, it's perfect for family dinners or casual gatherings.
instructions: In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat and add the chopped onion. Cook until caramelized, about 10 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, breadcrumbs, milk, egg, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and Worcestershire sauce. Mix until just combined.
Stir in the caramelized onions, being careful not to overmix.
Transfer the meat mixture into a loaf pan, shaping it into a loaf.
In a small bowl, mix ketchup, brown sugar, and Dijon mustard. Spread this glaze over the top of the meatloaf.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (70°C). Let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
tips: When caramelizing onions, patience is key; let them cook slowly to develop that sweet flavor. If you want a bit more zing, try adding some finely chopped herbs like thyme or rosemary. Leftovers can be stored in the fridge for up to 3 days and make a great sandwich filling!

structured_content.content: Let me tell you, this French onion meatloaf is a real crowd-pleaser! It's one of those dishes that feels like a warm hug on a chilly evening. The combination of caramelized onions and a tangy glaze makes it a standout at any dinner table. I usually whip this up when I want something comforting yet a bit special. It’s perfect for family gatherings or just a cozy night in!

For this recipe, you'll need a good blend of ground beef and pork to keep the meatloaf juicy and flavorful. The caramelized onions add a sweetness that balances beautifully with the tangy glaze. If you're out of breadcrumbs, crushed crackers or oats can work in a pinch!

Making this meatloaf is straightforward! Start by caramelizing the onions for that rich flavor, then mix everything together. The key is to not overmix the meat—just combine until it’s all incorporated. The glaze adds a nice finishing touch, giving it a sweet and savory kick!

structured_content.content: Here's the thing - This meatloaf pairs wonderfully with mashed potatoes or a simple green salad. You can also serve it with some crusty bread to soak up the delicious juices. If you have any leftovers, they make for amazing sandwiches the next day!
